p: Cancer is a debilitating disease that is on the increase in both developed and developing countries. It is the second leading cause of mortality after cardiovascular diseases in the U.S.A. In Nigeria, there are about 100,000 new cancer cases annually, and by the year 2020, the estimate would be 90.7 and 100.9 from every 100,000 Nigerian men and women, respectively [ 1â€“ 3]. Anticancer drugs are often expensive, have narrow spectrum of activities, and are associated with toxicities and side effects such as myelosuppression, immunosuppression, gastrointestinal disturbance, alopecia, skin toxicity, and hepatotoxicity.
